definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: He is one of the most talented and inventive drummers in modern music.
sentences.chinese: 他是現代音樂界最具天賦和創造力的鼓手之一。

sentences.english: There is a limit to the amount of creative talent available in the world.
sentences.chinese: 人世間的創造力是有一定限度的。

sentences.english: These projects showed the wisdom and innovativeness of the participating students.
sentences.chinese: 這些資助項目反映出大學生們的智慧和創造力。

sentences.english: Snagging a great, creative new job.
sentences.chinese: 粗磨一個大師，有創造力的新工作。

sentences.english: Viridian has assembled one of the best creative teams in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 維瑞點這次聚集好萊塢最賦創造力的團隊。

sentences.english: There is NO software development without creativity.
sentences.chinese: 沒有創造力就沒有軟件開發。

sentences.english: I have also marveled at XMUP's creativity.
sentences.chinese: 廈大出版社無窮的創造力也令我驚歎。
那麼有的便只有創造力。

sentences.english: Yes, creative people make things, and that’s what this chapter’s about.
sentences.chinese: 是的，有創造力的人能夠成事，這就是本章所介紹的。
這是一種富有創造力的表現自我的方式。

sentences.english: The power of the mind's creativity depends on the constant stimulation and encouragements.
sentences.chinese: 心靈的創造力是需要被時時的激發的。

sentences.english: “True creativity knows no bounds,” he enthuses.
sentences.chinese: “正真的創造力沒有邊界，”他激動地說。

sentences.english: By all means! It just takes a little Foxy strategy, ingenuity, and fashion smarts.
sentences.chinese: 只需要用一些小技巧，創造力和對時尚的智慧。

sentences.english: Creativity requires the harnessing of feeling as thinking.
sentences.chinese: 創造力需要控制感情和思考。

sentences.english: According to Zimmer, yellow can even stir our creative juices.
sentences.chinese: 據季默說黃色甚至能讓我們產生更多的創造力。

sentences.english: The creative Webmaster has a tremendous amount of information to put to work.
sentences.chinese: 具有創造力的網絡管理員需要處理大量的信息。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
